title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers Maxx Crosby, Trey Hendrickson, or Jaelan Phillips before NFL Draft.
Raiders reportedly demand two first-round picks for Maxx Crosby; Las Vegas not eager to trade him.
Patriots may focus on drafting Missouri's Zion Young to bolster pass rush; team holds 31st pick in draft.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance plans to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS may integrate, potentially reshaping MLB, NHL, and college football broadcast strategies.
Netflix forgoes buying Warner Bros. Discovery, potentially impacting future negotiations for NFL streaming rights.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly interested in trading for Eagles wide receiver A.J. Brown.
Philadelphia's current asking price for Brown is considered too high by the Patriots.
A trade involving Brown before June 1 incurs $44 million in dead money for the Eagles.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts switches E-ZPass from plastic transponders to RFID-enabled windshield stickers, starting Sunday, to improve toll collection efficiency.
Sticker tags are free for E-ZPass users, replacing costly transponders, saving the state an estimated $7.4 million annually.
The new RFID sticker tags cost 55 cents each to produce, compared to $6.70 per traditional transponder.

title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jean Brito, owner of Boston Quality Cleaning Services, is indicted for allegedly evading over $1.2 million in personal income taxes.
Brito pleaded not guilty to 10 charges, including tax evasion and filing false returns, in Middlesex Superior Court.
Authorities executed search warrants recovering $35,000 in cash and documents during the investigation of Brito's alleged tax evasion.

title: Beware the birds: Bird flu confirmed in Boston
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Bird flu has been confirmed in Boston's Emerald Necklace park system, prompting a public health advisory.
Boston Public Health Commission advises avoiding contact with wildlife; risk to public is currently considered low.
CDC reports 71 human bird flu cases since 2024; virus can cause symptoms similar to seasonal flu.

title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, top 2026 NFL Draft prospect, hopes for mentorship from Tom Brady on Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, 2025 Heisman winner from Indiana, views Brady as greatest quarterback and admires his Super Bowl successes.
Projected as No. 1 NFL Draft pick, Mendoza excelled with 3,535 yards and 41 touchdowns in college season.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' featuring Jennifer Lopez is now streaming on Hulu.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run', a new documentary, is available on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4 Part 2, featuring Benedict Bridgerton, streams on Netflix.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox outfielders Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided chasing a fly ball during a spring training game.
Both players were examined by trainers, remained in the game, and later recorded hits against the Atlanta Braves.
The collision was attributed to miscommunication, with both players concerned for each other's well-being afterward.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund for the first Red Sox player to hit 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's donation is his largest public contribution to the Jimmy Fund, which supports cancer care and research in Boston.
In previous years, Cora donated based on Red Sox wins and runs, linked to his jersey number, 13.
